Articles.Content:
Hi,

I just did this and now Serious is large overextending Kerbin and the other PF planets look like stock around Sentar; whats odd is now my memory issue dropped from 3.1 gigs to 2.6 gigs on running the game; I am gonna try putting the dll in a gamedata/plugin dir which technically isnt correct; wait you didnt even do that you are just putting the dll in gamedata dir? and plugindata ...no that is messed up I aint sayin it wont work but maybe there is a dir messup from the author..

all i know is I am still lookin for this blog someone complained to me in here saying this isnt a blog well I would like to know where else people are gonna talk about this - reddit??

EDIT: Hate to say it but the correct dirs:

Planetfactory/plugindata

the dll goes in the planetfactory dir; if you put it in a plugins dir it wont work and all the textures will get messed up and serious is over Kerbin; serious and joker need to be deleted; someone said Serious gravity was fixed in a blog and no one is getting back here on this fix.

zeta

Edited April 18, 2014 by Cdr_Zeta

Hello,

You can et Borland C Sharp, set the following dirs:

ksp_dev in your user dir

games/KerbalSpace/ksp_dev/Gamedata/PlanetFactory

I put the ksp_data dir in ksp_dev dir in user dir/ I dont know if it works in the second dir I just followed the 2 error codes til I got the right directories

This is for v.23 and the source is listed on spaceport at the bottom:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/krags-planet-factory/

reproduced here for brevity blog or not:

https://github.com/Kragrathea/PlanetFactory

Click download zip on the right and you have access to the master - which BTW does NOT include Serious Or Joker

I didnt get too far into my missions so I am goin the whole route again, letting it run and setting up asteroid encouters 50-100 dasys out then I am grabbin several with Hyperedit to do with as I want for challenges so I dont have to wait around...

I dont believe I can provide the recompiled planetfactory.dll as it would violate the license terms most likely; so you are all on your own to recompile this baby.

Serious and Joker are now gone and I get what I want harr harr...

Altho I do notice now that this mod is adding about 500 MEGS of game RAM just so as you know...

I will be streaming my new missions setup tonite yehaw !!!

See my stream thread for details...

Cdr Zeta
This looks like a really ambitious mod! I'm hoping that these tools get used to add planet-scale megastructures like a Dyson Swarm.
rrrg, the spaceport link is gone since spaceport is gone... i need this mod

rrrg, the spaceport link is gone since spaceport is gone... i need this mod

Get the creator edition, it's available. Krag has been gone on the forums for quite a while now, so don't expect this link to be fixed soon unless he comes back.

This is probably the easiest way:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/65401-WIP-PlanetFactory-CE

And here is an awesome example of what it can do:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/66882-0-23-Sido-s-Urania-System-16-new-planets-and-moon-!

Hope that helps

I posted a status update on PlanetFactory here:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/65401-WIP-PlanetFactory-CE?p=1336014&posted=1#post1336014

Dont get too excited. Its only a license change.

Krag

So...

This mod is awesome.

I don't mean to sound annoying (although no doubt I do), but, er...

Gonna update soon? Maybe for .24.5? Or maybe for .25?

@PTTG: There is no .24.5/ .25 version of KSP ^^ And everything works from this mod, except the science, and there are no contracts ^^ but the science is actually fixable and I'll try my best to help the rest of the community with it But there is no guarantee because I just began with modding and stuff like this:)

Working on a version of the Sentar expansion and Serious system for Kopernicus: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102163-WIP-Planet-Factory-Revived-for-Kopernicus-and-KittopiaTech-Version-0-01?p=1582084#post1582084

Sorry if this is a necro, but it's such a popular mod (at least CE) that I needed to post this.

On ‎2014‎-‎01‎-‎18 at 0:07 PM, GregroxMun said:

Serious

Serious is something no Kerbal Astronomer had expected. It was discovered 2000 years before THe sun, as Kerbals then really didn't like the sun, and just looked up at the stars for most of the time. It was recently revealed that Serious, the brightest star in the sky, actually orbits the sun. Because of the Kerbal Astronautical Union's definition of a planet, Serious is now considered a Gas Giant that happens to be fusing Hydrogen.

Joker

Joker is a tiny speck seen only with the best telescopes. Not much is known of it, hence it's name. Scientists speculate that is may also be very colorful.

Bary

Bary was once thought of as being a star in it's own right. closer inspection has led the Kerbal Astronautical Union to see it as a binary star, two stars, GInger and Fred.

Ginger

Ginger is one of the binary stars in the Bary system. It is perhaps the lonleyest twin any Kerbal has found, because Fred spends most of it's time talking to it's planet.

Fred

Fred is one of the binary stars in the Bary system. It has a planet orbiting it, and it probably loves it.

Barney

This legendary planet seems to spend most of it's time waiting for it. It would be an interesting challenge to accept going to this planet. Because this planet has no atmosphere, you should probably suit up before walking it's surface. True Story.

Slade

Slade is a moon of Barney. It is almost completely unknown if this moon actually exists, but we saw that the wobble of Fred was going up and down a little bit, and then we saw that the planet must be what's causing the wobble. But since planets don't wobble, there must be a moon here.

What about stella, plantar, and moonar?

13 hours ago, saturnsrings said:

What about stella, plantar, and moonar?

That post is literally over two years old. 

Edited May 7, 2016 by Red Iron Crown
Be nice, please.

@saturnsrings This mod is quite out of date and hasn't been maintained in a long time, I'd suggest checking out some more recent planet-adding mods based on Kopernicus. Closing this one, will reopen at the author's request.
